snippet: Mrs. Clinton visited Harlem to propose $125 billion in new spending for poor and minority communities, and Mr. Sanders barnstormed the South, pledging to combat institutional racism.
abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton and Sen Bernie Sanders attempt to gain support of black voters as critical South Carolina primary looms; Sanders, who is trying to corral Clinton's long-held advantages among blacks, professes similar themes about economic barriers.

byline.original: By AMY CHOZICK and YAMICHE ALCINDOR

lead_paragraph: Mrs. Clinton visited Harlem to propose $125 billion in new spending for poor and minority communities, and Mr. Sanders barnstormed the South, pledging to combat institutional racism.

headline.main: Eyeing South Carolina, Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders Vie for Crucial Voters
headline.print_headline: Eyeing South Carolina, Clinton and Sanders Vie for Crucial Black Voters
